key_risks: Economic sensitivity to global conditions and trade volumes
Intense competition from larger global shipping companies
Labor disputes and potential operational disruptions
controversies: Legal disputes over vessel approvals and environmental compliance
Labor disputes with the National Labor Relations Board
environmental_issues: Pressure to adopt more sustainable practices
social_issues: Labor disputes and potential operational disruptions
governance_issues: Compliance with evolving maritime and environmental regulations

sources.title: Matson Publishes New Environmental Sustainability Goals
sources.snippet: HONOLULU , Nov. 1, 2021 /PRNewswire/ -- Matson, Inc. (NYSE: MATX), a leading U.S. carrier in the Pacific, has published new long-term environmental goals in a Sustainability Report 2020 Supplement that commit the company to reducing fleet greenhouse gas (GHG) emissions by 40 percent by 2030, and achieving net zero fleet GHG emissions by 2050.

sources.title: Environmental Stewardship - MATSON
sources.snippet: As a U.S. maritime transportation company, we believe we have a role to play in working toward a lower carbon future. We have set an interim goal to achieve a 40% reduction in Scope 1 fleet emissions by 2030, measured against a 2016 baseline, and a longer-term goal to achieve net zero Scope 1 fleet emissions by 2050.

sources.title: Matson v. United Parcel Service, Inc., No. 13-36174 (9th Cir. 2016)
sources.snippet: Plaintiff filed suit against her employer, UPS, alleging a state law gender-based hostile work environment claim. A jury returned a verdict for plaintiff on that claim, but the district court granted UPS's motion for a new trial on the ground that the claim was preempted under section 301 of the Labor Management Relations Act (LMRA), 29 U.S.C. 185(a).
